text:
Hello and welcome back to the part
two of this five-lesson series where you

will learn
how to avoid using very and replace it

with more
advanced English words to speak English

fluently and confidently
in part one of this lesson series we

replaced these common English words
if you have missed watching the first

part
there is a link in the description right

here don't forget to watch
part one today I will cover another 10

commonly used words with very and give
you much better replacements for them so

you don't sound
boring in English don't forget to hit

like subscribe to the channel and
Click the bell so that you don't miss

new English lessons
excited to learn let's get started

number one
on the list is Very Quick -

you could say RAPID
rapid rapid

the stress is on the first part of the
word

/ra-puhd/ you can't make
rapid decisions when it comes to making

investments
of course with investments, you can't be

rapid after all it's money at stake
so that was rapid

Next up at number two
Very Perfect

I'm sure we all say this all the time
you could instead say FLAWLESS

/flaw-luhs/ something that's
without any imperfection or fault

is flawless
flawless, flawless

Eg - The room service at the hotel is
flawless it's relatively

rapid.  At number three
we have Very Shy, you can say

TIMID the pronunciation is /ti-muhd/
timid, one more time

timid, excellent! Eg. She's
timid and lacks confidence while meeting

new people
that's timid. Number four

Very Thirsty -  you can say
I am Parched

parched the pronunciation is
parched it's a one-syllable word

parched you don't pronounce
-ed at the end of the word you say a

soft
/t/ sound. Say it with me

parched parched
after an hour-long run in the park

i was totally parched and
exhausted next up we have

very hurt how can you replace
this basic english word

you can say i was battered
battered when you are significantly hurt

you are battered that's
battered for example her angry words

battered his feelings deeply
battered number six
very open you could replace it with

transparent that's
transparent i was hoping

you could consider my suggestions with a
transparent mind i am sure

we would reach an agreement soon
transparent

up next is very powerful
you could instead say compelling

the pronunciation is compelling
compelling one more time compelling

something that has a strong reason to
believe

is compelling an argument
or a movie can be

compelling i found the whole movie
compelling i don't mind watching it

again
eight very shiny

we can replace it with gleaming
that's gleaming gleaming

it's simple anything that's smooth
and shiny is gleaming

it's a better word to use instead of
very

shiny the car was
gleaming after a wax polish

it seemed as if it was new at number
nine

we have very talented
you can say gifted

gifted an example
ron is a uniquely gifted singer

his voice adds magic to the lyrics
gifted do you know someone who is

uniquely gifted with
some talent let me know in the comments

moving on we have very
worried it can be replaced with

depressed pretty simple
huh depressed rhea is depressed

about her speaking test she needs to
score a band

eight to get into a top university in
the uk

well you don't have to worry about your
english speaking skills

you have already gathered some fantastic
english words

go out there and flaunt your english use
these words

and speak english fluently and
confidently
let's quickly revise what we've learned

very quick rapid
very perfect flawless

very shy timid
very thirsty parched

very hurt battered
very open transparent

very powerful compelling
very shiny gleaming

very talented gifted
very worried depressed

that's all for today if you found this
lesson helpful

hit the like button share it with your
friends

subscribe to the channel and click the
bell so you don't miss such

engaging english lessons i will see you
soon

with the next part of this lesson series
until then keep learning and keep
practicing english bye
you
